``` {r testplot}
test <- HPI_Population_Unemp_MHI_poverty_Combined_Annual[ HPI_Population_Unemp_MHI_poverty_Combined_Annual$state == "AR", ]

scatter.smooth(test$year, test$HPI, main="HPI by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "HPI", col = "blue")

scatter.smooth(x=test$year, y=test$value, main="Unemployment by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Unemployment", col = "red")

scatter.smooth(x=test$year, y=test$poverty, main="% of People Below Poverty Level", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Poverty", ylim = c(0,20))

test$RMHI <- as.factor(test$RMHI)
plot(x=test$year, y=test$RMHI, main="Median Household Income by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "RMHI" )
#ERROR: Unable to properly plot graph for MHI or population


test$population <- as.integer(test$population)
plot(x=test$year, y=test$population, main="Population by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Population" )
#ERROR: Unable to properly plot graph for MHI or population


#test to show a scatterplot CA HPI data against year
```
